Posted By: Zulp (4/19/2010 5:48:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Of course, what makes this card ridiculous is its two mana cost. With that, you can play it basically whenever it would benefit you. This alone deserves a 4.5/5, but the new art pushes it up to 5/5.
  
   
I would almost want to splash white into a Madness / Hellbent deck just so that I could combo this with [One With Nothing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=One With Nothing).
  
   
Also, a [Barren Glory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Barren Glory)-based deck could benefit from this, since it won't have many permanents out anyway.
posts.html:
Of course, what makes this card ridiculous is its two mana cost. With that, you can play it basically whenever it would benefit you. This alone deserves a 4.5/5, but the new art pushes it up to 5/5.

I would almost want to splash white into a Madness / Hellbent deck just so that I could combo this with One With Nothing.

Also, a Barren Glory-based deck could benefit from this, since it won't have many permanents out anyway.

posts.post_content: This card is nuts. It kills your opponents board advantage, screws mana ramping decks, and sets back decks that draw lots of cards. If you are running artifact mana sources (mana vault, sol ring, khalni gen, moxs) this hits your opponents lands even harder. This has to be my favorite card of all time. 5/5 for sure.
